reviews.text: We recently spent one night in this beautiful hotel. We stayed in the old house which is heritage listed. We had three rooms which were really suites. Huge bedroom and sitting area, another small bedroom off it and an enclosed conservatory, verandah which overlooked a beautiful garden. The staff were amazing, nothing was too much trouble. Dinner and breakfast taken in the beautiful dining room was amazing. Loved everything about this place.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Connaught House at Mount Abu was very refreshing..Excellent service,courteous staff.We stayed at room number 10 at the cottage which offers a private balcony & larger room with superb views--really worth a visit !
reviews.title: Memorable Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely Hotel & awesome hospitality!! The Heritage Rooms have a distinct ,special decor & old world charm..
reviews.title: its really something diifernt from other

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i really happy to share with you its really something different form other
reviews.title: Are you Lucky enough to be Welcomed by COURTEOUS HOSPITALISM?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and hotel is awesome
reviews.title: Beautiful Place with a high class service

reviews.text: On a package tour, I ended up in an enormous suite with wonderful antique furniture and old photos, so I can't vouch for the value. I can endorse the great food and attentive service. On the down side, I sent out laundry in the morning, and it came back unwashed that evening. So I washed it and hung it on a towel rack with an electric heater to speed drying. Then I had to be careful not to turn on too many lights, or I would blow a fuse. However, the staff were diligent in fixing the problem. Lunch in the small garden is a real treat. Delicious and ample dinners were served in a dark enclosed dining room.
reviews.title: Quirky and delightful if you overlook shortfalls.

reviews.text: We visited Mt. Abu during our trip to Rajasthan. I selected the hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and also eagerness to stay at Heritage property. And it was upto the mark. The hotel is in vicinity to main market and a nice walk from Nakki Lake. Though small property, it is well maintained and the food is excellent. The heritage building gives you nostalgic feeling and it is a great experience.
reviews.title: Small but Good Heritage Property

reviews.text: This property owned by the Maharaja of Jodhpur is a wonderful find. Ask to stay in the original building, which we did. Our room was more like a suite. It was very spacious and beautifully decorated. The staff was attentive and the gentleman running the hotel was most helpful with ideas on what to do and had lots of interesting stories. The dining room in the original building is where we took our meals. Every meal was excellent and so relaxing to eat in our own home, so to speak.
reviews.title: Heritage hotel worthy of the Maharaja

reviews.text: We had booked this hotel since its a part of Welcomeheritage group and we are a fan of ITC hotels. This hotel belongs to Maharaja of Jodhpur and this is his smallest property. The heritage building has 5 rooms and the architecture is typical British architecture. The newer building has another 5 rooms but built in standard Indian hotel room style
reviews.title: Nice heritage hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in the heritage part. All the 5 rooms are different and unfortunately for us we got the room which is on the outside verandha and it seemed to be the smallest of the rooms. However the room had a bedroom, a changing room and a bathroom. Basic amenities were there in the room. The decor was typical old British style. Bathroom was neat and clean.
reviews.title: An oasis of peace in Mount Abu

reviews.text: Realy excellent one in Mount Abu. Heritage hotel and excellent services. Rooms are very spacious. Excellent food. very large garden area.Valuse of money.The whole experience for me and my family was excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for Stay in M.abu.

reviews.text: If you can stay in the old 'heritage' part of the hotel, the rooms are spacious, comfortable and well-appointed - and those facing the garden, with conservatory, are great! we stayed adjacent to our friends and were able to open the adjoining doors to make one big social space overlooking the private garden - lovely! Mount Abu can get quite busy but Connaught House is tucked away and secluded from the main 'drag' yet only a few minutes to wander down to the shops, restaurants and lake. Food was good, yet not over-generous in portions and comparatively pricey. All the waiting staff were very obliging and pleasant but a little clueless about efficient service! wifi was a great bonus, although it's radius doesn't stretch too far from the main reception area. Pretty garden spaces across the campus of the hotel.
reviews.title: A good place to relax!

reviews.text: My Rajashtan Vacation's Best moments........... Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff, Excellent Ambiance.
reviews.title: Simply Awesome

reviews.text: The whole experience for me and my family was that...... We Felt like the Royal Family and were treated like the royalty. A must stay place for family who wants to relax amongst birds and trees and in peace
reviews.title: Good Stay But Food need improvement

reviews.text: I stayed at Connaught House from 25th March to 30th March 2013. We were in cottage no. 6. It is a very big accommodation with two rooms , two bathrooms and two LCDs. The rooms are well kept and have wooden flooring. The furniture is very nice and have heritage touch. There is a big sit out in front of the room with chairs and table. You can just sit down and can enjoy the morning tea with your spouse. It is a small property with only 10 nos. of cottages. The heritage character of the property has been well maintained. There is a good collection of novels which one can read leisurely as per the convenience. This property has the residential staff. So service is quite good and prompt. The property is located quite closed to the nakki lake and the main market of Mount Abu but it is far from the routine disturbances of the market place.
reviews.title: Stylish and attractive heritage property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited Mount Abu for 2 nights and selected this place because of his royal status and expecting similar service.
reviews.title: Good Hotel but need some action to make it Wow Hotel

reviews.text: Room selected was spacious for a couple and nice seat-out overlooking garden, typical English style (do doubt it was because of this hotel/house build during British rule).
reviews.title: A royal experience

reviews.text: It is small garden and good seat-out for small group to have informal chat.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: In heritage wing, there is a common dining area/table which give you chance to interact with other guest (like we got change to meeting a couple from Germany and one from Kolkata).
reviews.title: Charming property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is situated near main market & Nakki Lake (10 mins walk).
reviews.title: Beautifuk property
